testCases.explanation: With at most 1 stop: 0->1->3 costs 100+600=700. The path 0->1->2->3 requires 2 stops.
With 1 stop allowed: 0->1->2 costs 200, cheaper than 0->2 direct at 500.
With 0 stops (direct only): must take 0->2 costing 500.
Direct flight from 0 to 1 with 0 stops costs 100.
Direct flight from 0 to 1 costs 100; having extra stop allowance doesn't change cost.

description:
Solve the **Cheapest Flights Within K Stops** problem.

There are n cities and m flights. flights[i] = [from, to, price]. Given src, dst, and k, find the cheapest price from src to dst with at most k stops. Return -1 if no such route exists.

See the full problem description on [LeetCode](https://leetcode.com/problems/cheapest-flights-within-k-stops/).
